States of the Union, and of specialized groups such as the Association
of American Women in Radio and Television, the National Association of
Radio and Television Broadcasters, calls for a maximum use of all

9* Every broadcaster will be asked to volunteer his personal
efforts and the facilities of his station to the local organization
concerned with highway safety* In addition each State association will
be asked to volunteer its assistance to the governors of the several
States in the establishment of State programs concerned with highway
safety*
Respectfully submitted, HAROLD E. FELLOWS, Chairman
Daily Newspaper Committee
The 3ii-man committee representing the daily newspapers in the
White House Conference on Highway Safety recommends to t he President of
the United States that the Conference:
1* Strongly encourage the creation of a permanent organization
or agency to cariy on its work the year around and disseminate news and
material for the information of the nation1 s daily press*
2. Urge the nation*s daily press to enlist the press associations
in disseminating highway safety news on a broader and more dramatic scale
by wire and other means*
3* Urge the newspapers to strive to improve and humanize their
spot coverage of accidents, concentrating on the personalities of the
individuals involved and the effects of the accidents on the individual
or his survivors.
Request the daily press to exchange ideas on the various
devices and methods proved successful in local and regional highway safety
campaigns, and that the American Newspaper Publishers* Association be
asked to serve as the medium of distribution*
5* Urge the daily newspapers in their State associations to move
in concert in highway safety educational work, employing their wire assoÂ¬
ciations within their States on highway safety problems common to them.
6* Request the President of the United States to write a letter
to each of the publishers and the editors-in-chief of the nation*s daily
newspapers asking him to enlist his personal interest and the influence
of his newspaper in the White House Highway Safety Conference Crusade for
Safety.
